ai-ps1.8:1.2_0: “Mendicants, there are these four perversions of perception, mind, and view.
ai-ps1.8:1.3_0: What four? A person may have:
ai-ps1.8:1.8_0: These are the four perversions of perception, mind, and view.
ai-ps1.8:2.1_0: There are these four corrections of perception, mind, and view.
ai-ps1.8:2.2_0: What four? A person may have:
ai-ps1.8:2.7_0: These are the four corrections of perception, mind, and view.
ai-ps1.8:3.5_0: sentient beings are ruined by wrong view,
ai-ps1.8:4.1_0: Yoked by Māra’s yoke, these people
ai-ps1.8:4.4_0: and fare on in birth and death.
ai-ps1.8:5.1_0: And when the Buddhas in the world
ai-ps1.8:5.3_0: they shine a light on this teaching,
ai-ps1.8:6.1_0: When a wise person hears them,
ai-ps1.8:8.1_0: A person accomplished in view has given up these four ways.
ai-ps1.8:8.5_0: Taking not-self as self, pertinence, the mental development of perception, and the mind.
ai-ps1.8:8.6_0: perception of ugliness, beauty, happiness, glory, so is given up.
ai-ps1.8:8.7_0: Mendicants, he has given up two arrows.
ai-ps1.8:8.8_0: Two parts they’ve given up abundant cloth:
ai-ps1.8:8.9_0: Under the four darts, they’ve given up sorrows.
ai-ps1.8:8.10_0: The account of the one on retreat is finished.
